availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Zack W. T. Pinnell (Oldham County, Kentucky, farmer, merchant, and postmaster)

body.p: Oldham County, Kentucky, farmer, merchant, and postmaster. Oldham County, Kentucky, native. Son of Zack Pinnell and Nellie Willhoit Pinnell. Married to Mary Jane Hall Pinnell in Oldham County, Kentucky, on March 9, 1848. Father of J. C. Pinnell. Married to Sarah A. Caldwell Pinnell in Oldham County, Kentucky, on February 1, 1853. Father of L. Duran Pinnell, Arthur Pinnell, Ellen Pinnell, Morriss Pinnell, and Lou M. Pinnell. Farmer in Oldham County in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Oldham County in 1850. Merchant in Oldham County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Oldham County in 1860. Postmaster in Brownsborough in Oldham County from August 5, 1863, to February 13, 1877.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Division 1, p. 142A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Division 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, p. 914.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, p. 173B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Brownsboro, p. 16B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994051, Oldham County Marriages.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Oldham County Marriages, Film 000482442.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 4571.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971 Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, Oldham County, Kentucky, vol. 45, p. 376.
